stimulusHtml: A current I1 is established in a long, straight wire. A thin, square conductive loop is placed next to the wire, as shown. Which of the following statements best describes a change that could be made to the system to induce a clockwise current in the loop and provides a correct justification?
choicesHtml: Decrease the magnitude of current I1. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to increase the decreasing flux.
Increase the magnitude of current I1. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to decrease the increasing flux.
Move the loop closer to the wire. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to decrease the increasing flux.
Move the loop parallel to the wire. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to increase the decreasing flux.
